taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus erigeron;species clokeyi;variety pinzliae

bio:treatment.description: Leaves uniformly hispidulous to hirsutulous (hairs spreading to spreading-arching, stiff). Cypselae 1.8–2 mm. 2n = 18.
Dry, rocky habitats, dry meadows, sometimes with sagebrush or mountain mahogany, common in treeless areas, often with yellow, bristlecone, or limber pine;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety pinzliae is found in California, central Nevada, and west-central Utah. It apparently is discontinuously different from var. clokeyi and might be better treated at specific rank. Its relationship to Erigeron pygmaeus should be studied in such a consideration.
